techmeme.title: Meta antitrust case is the first major test of President Trump's FTC and its chair Andrew Ferguson, a Big Tech critic; Meta is exploring a possible settlement (Financial Times)
President Trump reiterates he's open to tariff relief for China if it approves the sale of TikTok's US operations; the app faces an April 5 divestment deadline (Annmarie Hordern/Bloomberg)
US officials say NSA director and Cyber Command head Timothy Haugh was fired on April 3, along with his deputy Wendy Noble (Washington Post)
Bengaluru-based Scapia, which offers a travel-focused credit card and a travel app, raised a $40M Series B led by Peak XV, bringing its total funding to $72M (The Economic Times)
Report: Brazil's antitrust regulator is investigating Apple over ATT, saying Apple collects user data "under more favorable conditions", after Meta complained (Filipe Espósito/9to5Mac)
